name: Bridget Fonda
description: American actress who played Grace Hamilton in The Godfather Part III.

content.title: Biography
content.body: Bridget Fonda was born on January 27, 1964, in Los Angeles, California, into the Fonda acting family. Trained in a lineage of Hollywood performers, she developed an early passion for acting. Fonda became a popular figure in 1990s cinema, known for her compelling performances in both dramas and thrillers, before largely retiring from acting in the early 2000s.

content.title: Career
content.body: Fonda’s acting career included significant roles in films like Singles (1992), Jackie Brown (1997), and Point of No Return (1993). In The Godfather Part III, she portrayed Grace Hamilton, the mistress of Michael Corleone, whose complex relationship offers emotional stakes within the storyline. Bridget’s career is marked by her ability to convey vulnerability and strength in equal measure.

content.title: Notable Works
content.body: Bridget Fonda is recognized for lead roles in Point of No Return, where she showcased her dramatic capabilities, and Jackie Brown, Quentin Tarantino’s critically acclaimed film. Her role as Grace Hamilton in The Godfather Part III added significant dramatic tension, encapsulating themes of love and tragedy within the crime saga.

content.title: Style and Influence
content.body: Fonda is known for her naturalistic performance style and ability to inhabit multifaceted characters that blend toughness and emotional openness. Her contributions during the 1990s helped define strong female roles in crime and thriller genres. Her legacy continues to inspire portrayals of complex women in Hollywood.
